lines.text: Mary, since your mother died, I've tried to be some kind of family to you, but you keep treating me like an ATM machine.
Judy, you know I'd love you even if you didn't spit out crisp twenties!
Your mother and I argued for months about that!
I love the freedom of not knowing what I'm gonna do until I'm apologizing for having done it!
Work isn't supposed to interfere with your life, it's supposed to pay for it!
Oneal, settle a bet. Is ignorance bliss?
I don't know. I just wanna be happy!
I could have sworn some little girl from Kansas dropped a house on her!
You know how some pill bottles say, "Don't operate heavy machinery"? Right now, Judy could kill herself with a tissue!
God, I hate it when something exciting is going on and I'm not parachuting into the center of it!
